revised_title: Development of a Scanning X-ray Spectroheliograph for Solar Studies
tldr: The authors developed a scanning X-ray spectroheliograph to study the solar corona. They used a grazing incidence mirror system to focus X-rays onto a proportional counter, enabling the detection of X-ray spectra from both quiet and active coronal regions. The instrument was launched on two Skylark rocket flights, providing valuable data for solar research.
